intro: Karpatiosorbus adeana, commonly known as the Carpathian rowan, is a shrub native to the Carpathian Mountains in Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces red berries in the autumn, which are a food source for various birds and mammals. Karpatiosorbus adeana is typically found in forested areas and is adapted to temperate climates with well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in regions with similar growing conditions.
